column4: So if I've compiled something from source and want to uninstall it, do I have to have the same source to do the 'sudo make uninstall' ?
if I've rm'd that original source, will it be a problem if I re-download it, extract, and then do the sudo make uninstall in the new source?
as along as they're the same version and all
If you get the same source, then I think it should work.
maybe you could check the version of your program and then look for that version of the source
so it will be a huge hassle to redownload
I wish there was an uninstall binary that was outside of the source that was put in /usr/bin or whatever
is there any man page for that program?
does it have a man page?  Maybe the man page has some info?
